moodish.comm

Interface ServerComm

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MoodishSecurityFilter, ServerCommDecorator, ServerCommDummy

    public interface ServerComm
    Communication interface for a Moodish server. A Moodish server must communicate clients exclusively through this interface.
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    alc

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean clientIsConnected(java.lang.String nickname)
      Checks if a client with a certain nickname is currently connected.
      void disconnectClient(java.lang.String nickname)
      Disconnect a client.
      ServerSideMessage getNextMessage()
      Get the next message received from one of the clients.
      boolean hasNextMessage()
      Checks if a message from a client is pending.
      void sendClientConnected(java.lang.String toNickname, java.lang.String connectedNickname)
      Inform a client that a new client has connected.
      void sendClientDisconnected(java.lang.String toNickname, java.lang.String disconnectedNickname)
      Inform a client that another client disconnected.
      void sendError(java.lang.String toNickname, java.lang.String error)
      Report an error to a client.
      void sendMoodishMessage(java.lang.String fromNicename, java.lang.String toNickname, java.lang.String moodishMessage)
      Send a message to a client.
      void sendNewFriendship(java.lang.String toNickname, java.lang.String newFriendship)
      Inform a client that another client is now a friend.
      void sendNewUnfriendship(java.lang.String toNickname, java.lang.String unfriendship)
      Inform a client that a former friend has decided to not be friend anymore.
      void start()
      Starts the Moodish server.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start()
        Starts the Moodish server. The method should setup a server socket and begin to accept connections. This method must return immediately after a server socket has been setup, and another thread should started to listen for connections.

      • getNextMessage

        ServerSideMessage getNextMessage()
        Get the next message received from one of the clients. If no message is has been received, the method blocks until a message has been received.
        Returns:
        The next message sent by one of the connected clients to the server

      • hasNextMessage

        boolean hasNextMessage()
        Checks if a message from a client is pending. If hasNextMessage() returns true, a call to getNextMessage() will return immediately with the oldest message in the queue. If hasNextMessage() returns false, a call to getNextMessage() will block until a message has been received.
        Returns:
        true if a message from a client is currently pending, otherwise false.

      • sendMoodishMessage

        void sendMoodishMessage(java.lang.String fromNicename,
                      java.lang.String toNickname,
                      java.lang.String moodishMessage)
        Send a message to a client. This method should be used to relay messages received from a client to a friend. This method should be called once for each friend.
        Parameters:
        fromNickname - The nickname of the client from which the message was sent
        toNickname - The nickname of a friend
        moodishMessage - The message

      • sendNewFriendship

        void sendNewFriendship(java.lang.String toNickname,
                     java.lang.String newFriendship)
        Inform a client that another client is now a friend.
        Parameters:
        toNickname - nickname of the client who has a new friend
        newFriendship - nickname of the new friend

      • sendNewUnfriendship

        void sendNewUnfriendship(java.lang.String toNickname,
                       java.lang.String unfriendship)
        Inform a client that a former friend has decided to not be friend anymore.
        Parameters:
        toNickname - nickname of the client who has lost a friend
        unfriendship - nickname of the unfriendship

      • sendError

        void sendError(java.lang.String toNickname,
             java.lang.String error)
        Report an error to a client. An error can, for instance, be trying to be friend of a client who is not connected, trying to unfriend of a client not currently our friend, and so on.
        Parameters:
        toNickname - nickname of the client.
        error - description of the error.

      • sendClientConnected

        void sendClientConnected(java.lang.String toNickname,
                       java.lang.String connectedNickname)
        Inform a client that a new client has connected. When a new client connects, the server should call this method for each client already connected to inform the newly connected client about the clients currently online.
        Parameters:
        toNickname - nickname of the client to whom to send the message.
        connectedNickname - nickname of the connected client.

      • sendClientDisconnected

        void sendClientDisconnected(java.lang.String toNickname,
                          java.lang.String disconnectedNickname)
        Inform a client that another client disconnected.
        Parameters:
        toNickname - nickname of the client to whom to send the message.
        disconnectedNickname - nickname of client who disconnected.

      • clientIsConnected

        boolean clientIsConnected(java.lang.String nickname)
        Checks if a client with a certain nickname is currently connected.
        Parameters:
        nickname - nickname of the client to check.
        Returns:
        true if a client with the nickname is currently connected, otherwise false.

      • disconnectClient

        void disconnectClient(java.lang.String nickname)
        Disconnect a client.
        Parameters:
        nickname - nickname of the client to disconnect.
